wikipedia_page.main: Francis "Frank" Bowen (19 Sep 1896 – c. 1964) was an English professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1920s and 1930s. He played at representative level for Great Britain and Lancashire, and at club level for St. Helens Recs and St. Helens, as a prop, or second-row, i.e. number 8 or 10, or, 11 or 12, during the era of contested scrums.

Template talk:Great Britain squad – 1928 Australia & New Zealand Tourists
response: The Canberra Times article of Friday 2 March 1928 entitled Rugby Team - To Tour Australia - 23 Players Named does not mention Tom Askin, and Joe Thompson, but they did play in Test matches on this tour, and it does not mention Walter Gowers, but he did play in non-Test matches on this tour. Bowen (St. Helens) is actually Frank Bowen of St. Helens Recs, all four players can be seen on the photograph entitled  Great Britain Rugby League Touring Team - Australasia 1928. Best Regards. DynamoDegsy (talk) 15:42, 28 November 2012 (UTC)
* Frank Bowen won caps for Great Britain while at St. Helens Recs in 1928 against New Zealand (3 matches)
